channel.title: Only I can log into my server

item.title: Only I can log into my server
item.dc:creator: @NexondotNet NexondotNet
item.description:
@NexondotNet wrote:

[quote=“Lamez, post:8, topic:106261”]oh ok, open up your router
most likely 192.168.1.1 then type in your user name and password unless changes it would be user: admin and pass: admin

then click on the application and gaming tab. then in the Application Box, type RS Server, in the start and end box type your sources port number, then in the IP box type your ip address, you can find it by going to START>RUN>type CMD, then type ipconfig/all and find where it says and copy that number into the box. click on the check, and make sure you have all the other box’s unchecked besides the one you just checked.

Hope That Help, be sure to set up your IP, in the network connections[/quote]

I’ve done all that besides this -
“be sure to set up your IP, in the network connections” what you mean?

Read full topic
item.source: Only I can log into my server

item.title: Only I can log into my server
item.dc:creator: @Lamez Lamez
item.description:
@Lamez wrote:

oh ok, open up your router
most likely 192.168.1.1 then type in your user name and password unless changes it would be user: admin and pass: admin

then click on the application and gaming tab. then in the Application Box, type RS Server, in the start and end box type your sources port number, then in the IP box type your ip address, you can find it by going to START>RUN>type CMD, then type ipconfig/all and find where it says and copy that number into the box. click on the check, and make sure you have all the other box’s unchecked besides the one you just checked.

Hope That Help, be sure to set up your IP, in the network connections

Read full topic

item.title: Only I can log into my server
item.dc:creator: @NexondotNet NexondotNet
item.description:
@NexondotNet wrote:

[quote=“Lamez”]1.Download Source
2.Download No-IP
3.Port Forward
4.Compile and Run[/quote]

I’m not trying to learn how to make a server here. I’m trying to figure out how to portforward correctly, as I may have done it wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Only I can log into my server
item.dc:creator: @Lamez Lamez
item.description:
@Lamez wrote:

1.Download Source
2.Download No-IP
3.Port Forward
4.Compile and Run[br][size=1]Posted on: June 05, 2007, 03:01:34 AM[/size][hr]when you click on run.bat

it says server starting on: 5555 <-that is your port search for what ever number that is

item.description:
@NexondotNet wrote:

Oh Noes! PIERATS!:

then you will have to open the port your server uses. open server.java and search for “port” untill you find it then open that port.

What do you mean “open that port”?

item.title: Only I can log into my server
item.dc:creator: @Oh_Noes_PIERATS Oh Noes! PIERATS!
item.description:
@Oh_Noes_PIERATS wrote:

You’ve got your firewall up blocking connections or your router is not forwarding the ports correctly. http://portforward.com/
